body:
@mattfarina This is getting a bit off topic.

Are you aware of "gopkg.in"? For example: "gopkg.in/natefinch/npipe.v2" It is a proxy service for go packages that uses go tags to make a new import path. Developers can optionally use the package comment to enforce an import path.

Other examples include "labix.org/v2/mgo".

Regarding kubernetes importing "go-semver" 4 times, this is an argument for using the "vendor" folder universally and doesn't really have a direct tie in to version numbers.

If you'd like to discuss this more, start a discussion on go-nuts or https://forum.golangbridge.org/ please. Some of your questions I suspect could be answered with searches on go-nuts as they have been discussed several years ago. Thanks!
